title: iPhone SE, iPad Air, Mac Studio and More: How Apple’s Newest Products Measure Up
sub_head: Apple aims its newest computer and display at creative professionals, while its lowest-end iPhone gets a faster chip, 5G connectivity and a higher price
body:
Upgrades to a popular iPhone and iPad, plus a brand-new Mac with matching monitor: Apple  had a busy Tuesday, or at least a busy virtual event.
The focus of the news was speed. Apple is bringing fast 5G cellular connectivity to the new iPhone SE and the new iPad Air. Both of those devices and the all-new Mac Studio desktop computer have faster chips. And the company showed off the Studio Display, aimed at professionals, with a built-in camera and a whopping price starting at $1,599.
